name: FountainheadRuntimeDescription

classitems.description: Looks through the passed-in template string and checks for action helpers; when it finds some, it checks for the actions referenced and registers no-ops for them on this component's context so that the application doesn't explode when trying to reference a non-existent action.
classitems.name: _checkActionRefs

params.name: templateString
params.description: The template string to run the check for action matches on

classitems.description:
Grabs the input from the parent instance's code editor, compiles it into a real-live HTMLBars template, registers it on the container as a partial and makes it available as output for the preview component's template to render.

New partials are created for every change, using a date string as the partial name to avoid collisions.

TODO: Use lookup partial names that can be mapped and retrieved instead of making new ones each time
classitems.name: _generateDescription

classitems.description: If there is a parsing error during the template compilation the catch block will set it as the compilerError. This parsing error is rendered for easier debugging of invalid content.
classitems.name: compilerError

classitems.description: The content string that should be rendered. This string is passed to the runtime compiler and registered as a partial if compilation is successful.
classitems.name: content

classitems.description: The string that should be converted to a partial
classitems.name: description

classitems.description: Whenever attrs are received fire the _generateDescription method to generate a partial that will be rendered.
classitems.name: didReceiveAttrs

classitems.description: On init we map the passed contextActions to real actions in this component's actions hash to ensure they're available at compile time.
classitems.name: init

classitems.description: Name of generated partial that is used in the template.
classitems.name: partialName

description:
Generates a description during runtime by using HTMLBars to compile any string to a partial. This allows us to create descriptions from JSON responses with components inside of them.

TODO: Name partials by class+type+name for re-use

method.description: Looks through the passed-in template string and checks for action helpers; when it finds some, it checks for the actions referenced and registers no-ops for them on this component's context so that the application doesn't explode when trying to reference a non-existent action.
method.name: _checkActionRefs

params.name: templateString

method.name: _generateDescription

method.description: On init we map the passed contextActions to real actions in this component's actions hash to ensure they're available at compile time.
method.name: init

property.description: If there is a parsing error during the template compilation the catch block will set it as the compilerError. This parsing error is rendered for easier debugging of invalid content.
property.name: compilerError

property.description: The content string that should be rendered. This string is passed to the runtime compiler and registered as a partial if compilation is successful.
property.name: content

property.description: The string that should be converted to a partial
property.name: description

property.description: Name of generated partial that is used in the template.
property.name: partialName

event.description: Whenever attrs are received fire the _generateDescription method to generate a partial that will be rendered.
event.name: didReceiveAttrs
